DataElement.preferredName: Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System Breast Density Criteria Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coding system used by the Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System Breast Density Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the basis for comparison of the Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) Atlas to standardize breast-imaging reporting and to facilitate outcome monitoring. The atlas contains a guide to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) Atlas is a quality assurance guide to standardize breast-imaging reporting and to facilitate outcome monitoring. The atlas contains a guide to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system.

Concepts.longName: Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System
Concepts.definition: The Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) Atlas is a quality assurance guide to standardize breast-imaging reporting and to facilitate outcome monitoring. The atlas contains a guide to standardized mammographic reporting, including a breast-imaging lexicon of terminology, a report organization and assessment structure and coding system.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:The amount of something per unit size.:Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
The amount of something per unit size.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
